description: Subdivision of existing site on 2x separate residential plots, planting of a site boundary hedge and provision of refuse and recycling facilities
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, evidence showing that the development has achieved at least a 19% improvement in CO2 emissions versus Part L of the Building Regulations and internal water usage rates of no greater than 105L per person per day have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation, in accordance with policy 5.2 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS1, DM3 and DM4 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The refuse and recycling facilities as shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained thereafter. The developer and/or their successors in title shall take all reasonable steps to ensure that all refuse and recyclable materials associated with the development are either stored within these facilities or internally within the building(s) on the application site, and that no refuse or recycling material is stored or placed for collection on the public highway except on the day of collection.Reason: To ensure proper waste management in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policies 5.17 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in strict accordance with the landscaping shown on the approved plans, which shall be implemented within the first planting season following substantial completion of the development. The laurel hedge shall thereafter be maintained for five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority and any part of it which dies during this period shall be replaced during the following planting season.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The windows at first floor level in the north-eastern elevation in the building to which this permission relates shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut to a height of 1.7m above finished floor level and permanently retained as such thereafter.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) (or any Order revoking and reenacting that Order with or without modification), no further windows or other openings shall be inserted at first floor level or above in the north-eastern elevation of the building to which this permission relates unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The garaging or car parking shown on the approved plans shall be provided with a hard-bound, adequately-drained, dust-free surface prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates and shall be permanently retained and kept free from obstruction thereafter. It shall not be used for any purposes other than the parking of vehicles for the occupiers of and visitors to the development.Reason: To ensure the provision of adequate off-street parking in the interests of the safety and operation of the highway network, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS7 and DM9 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
All other planing conditions on planning permission 95/6060/FUL remain in full force, other than the conditions amended / removed by this planning permission.Reason: For the avoindace of doubt

The assessment of this application is been based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify the validity of this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings.

The details submitted for Condition 4 (Construction Management Plan) by the applicant are considered satisfactory and this condition is hereby approved.The Council's Neighbourhood Traffic Engineer is satisfied with the information provided for Condition 4 and recommended approval of Condition 4.

The Council's Landscape and Tree Officer is satisfied with the information provided for Conditions  5 (Landscaping Scheme), 6 (Arboricultural Method Statement) and 7 (Tree Protection Measures). As such these conditions are hereby approved.The proposed works should be carried out in accordance with the submitted Arboricultural Method Statement 20.04.2020, Tree Protction Plan and Landscaping Plan L01/B and the approved Arboricultural Report October 2019 (planning permission ref. no. 19/02663/FUL).

Historic England is satisfied with the information provided for the written scheme of investigation for an archaeological watching brief (TVAS April 2020) and recommended partial discharge of Condition 9 (Written Scheme of Investigation). The condition 9 will not be fully satisfied until all works are complete, including any post-excavation assessment/analysis leading to publication.As such, the details submitted for Condition 9 by the applicant are considered satisfactory and therefore Condition 9 is hereby partially approved.

Please provide amended copy of proposed  front elevation at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work.Please note that the hip to gable roof extension shows overhanging the first floor area.

"Conversion of garage into habitale space, erection of single storey front and side extensions, including installation of new raised front flat roofs with associated changes to fenestration. Formation of new driveway."Please confirm description of works as the application form description does not correspond with the proposed works in the plans and/or supporting documents.  Confirmation can be in writing.
duplicate application of 20/02927/PASCH, 20/03200/FUL and  20/03253/FULPlease refer to email of 18/12/2020 on DMS

Please provide revised copies of existing and proposed floor plans/elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works.Please note that the scale bar on revised drawings do not scale correctly at 1:50. Please amend and resubmit.

Please submit a revised copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North pointPlease note that the site location plan submitted is an outdated Land Registry plan. You would need to submit a current Ordnance Survey based site location plan.
Please provide a revised copy of block plan scaled 1:500 showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.
